conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to block all non-critical notifications during work hours to avoid distractions, potentially forbidding notifications that User Story B needs to provide interactive tools and notifications fostering emotional bonding, creating opposing instructions for notification delivery.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member who is very busy and handles patients one at a time, I want ALFRED to block all non-critical notifications during my work hours so that I can avoid distractions and focus exclusively on urgent patient care needs.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple elderly clients, I want ALFRED to provide interactive tools that support me in building emotional connections with my clients, helping me nurture relationships in a way that fits my busy schedule and respects each client's comfort with digital engagement.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to block all non-critical notifications during work hours (forbid notifications), while User Story B allows manual control to enable or disable notifications selectively, potentially allowing non-critical notifications. These opposing instructions on notification handling during overlapping contexts create a Start-Forbid conflict.
userStoryASummary: As a medical staff member who is very busy and handles patients one at a time, I want ALFRED to block all non-critical notifications during my work hours so that I can avoid distractions and focus exclusively on urgent patient care needs.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually choose which health data is logged and control notification settings to avoid being overwhelmed by non-essential alerts while maintaining my clients' privacy and staying attentive to their needs.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires blocking all non-critical notifications during work hours (forbidding operation), while User Story B requires receiving all cognitive engagement notifications including non-critical ones (starting operation) for multiple clients, creating opposing instructions on notification handling.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires blocking all non-critical notifications during work hours (implying a very low notification frequency), while User Story B requires individualized control over notification frequency for each client, potentially allowing more frequent notifications.
